intro: Chamaesyce, commonly known as sandspurry, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Portulacaceae. These plants are typically low-growing and have succulent, fleshy leaves that help them retain water in arid environments. They produce small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Chamaesyce species are often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in regions with mild climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
